newsitem.title: JAPAN: Body found on Japan coast may be tanker captain.
newsitem.headline: Body found on Japan coast may be tanker captain.

text.p: Japanese maritime officials said on Monday they may have found the body of the captain of a Russian tanker that broke up early this month causing Japan's worst oil spill.

"The body of a foreigner has been found by a local resident which matches the captain's body size and shape. Local police are working to identify whether it is the captain or not," a Maritime Safety Agency (MSA) official said.
The body was found on Sunday night on Shirahama beach near Echizen in Fukui prefecture, about 300 km (190 miles) west of Tokyo.

The 13,157-tonne Russian tanker Nakhodka, carrying 19,000 tonnes (133,000 barrels) of fuel oil, broke in two in stormy waters in the Sea of Japan on January 2 some 130 km (80 miles) off the coast of of Fukui prefecture.
The tanker's crew members were all rescued except for captain Valeriy Melnikov, who has been missing and presumed dead.
"The body's condition is consistent with a long period of immersion in the sea," the MSA official said.
He said Russian diplomats were travelling to the area to examine the body to make a positive identification.
The tanker disaster has claimed three other lives, all elderly men who died from heart attacks while assisting in cleanup operations along a lengthy stretch of coastline.
The spill has badly polluted rich fishing grounds and many popular tourist beaches.
